programme.title: Sixteen Candles (1983)
programme.desc: On the eve of her sister's wedding, suburban teenager Samantha suffers silently as her family forgets her birthday. Even worse, some total dork keeps propositioning her with sophomoric innuendo when she really craves romantic attention from high-school hunk Jake. Moving from Samantha's family home as it's invaded by outre relatives to a high-school dance where nothing seems to go her way, this bittersweet teen comedy traces the hopes and disappointments not only of Samantha...

programme.title: Ghost (1990)
programme.desc: Jerry Zucker's fantasy story stars Patrick Swayze as Sam Wheat and Demi Moore as Molly Jensen. He's killed in an apparent random mugging, leaving her heartbroken. But when it transpires he was murdered to stop him exposing a major fraud, Molly's in danger because the incriminating information is in her possession. Sam's ghost, still earthbound, finds out that the only way to warn her is through Oda Mae Brown, a fake medium who suddenly finds she's his channel to the living. A mix of comedy, thriller and romance (throwing a pot will never be the same again) coupled with outstanding special effects have turned this into an enduring, enjoyable classic.

programme.title: Airplane! (1980)
programme.desc: (1980) Jim Abrahams and David and Jerry Zucker's film, which launched a thousand imitators, remains the classic mould-breaking comedy. Peter Graves plays Captain Oveur, the stricken captain of a packed plane. Can passenger Ted Striker (Robert Hays) overcome the traumas he suffered as a wartime pilot and land the plane with the help of his ex-girlfriend, stewardess Elaine (Julie Hagerty) or are they all doomed? Verbal and sight gags galore lampoon every cinematic genre, with Leslie Nielsen and Robert Stack among the distinguished cast happy to make fools of themselves. And don't call me Shirley.

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia.

programme.title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine (2009)
programme.desc: Tsotsi and Rendition director Gavin Hood's fantasy adventure explores the backstory of the most hirsute and mercurial of the X-Men: Wolverine. The tale kicks off in 1845 with the incident that sparked the young James Howlett's initial mutation and his alliance with Victor Creed. Over the course of the next century the two immerse themselves in a series of major conflicts, right up to the Vietnam War, where they are recruited by Major Stryker to join Team X: a killing machine staffed by other mutants. Uncomfortable with the merciless, legally dubious methods the unit employs, Howlett leaves, seeking a quiet life. Over the course of the next few years, Howlett, now known as Logan, seems to have realised his dream, having settled down with his girlfriend Kayla. However, a violent, catastrophic incident turns Logan's world upside down, propelling him on a course that will result in confrontation with his former ally Creed, as well as Logan's final transmogrification into Wolverine. Also starring Ryan Reynolds, Taylor Kitsch and Will.i.am.

programme.title: The Adjustment Bureau (2011)
programme.desc: Do we control our destiny, or do unseen forces manipulate us? Matt Damon stars in the thriller The Adjustment Bureau as a man who glimpses the future Fate has planned for him and realizes he wants something else. To get it, he must pursue the only woman he¿s ever loved across, under and through the streets of modern-day New York. On the brink of winning a seat in the U.S. Senate, ambitious politician David Norris (Damon) meets beautiful contemporary ballet dancer Elise Sellas (Emily Blunt)¿a woman like none he¿s ever known. But just as he realizes he¿s falling for her, mysterious men conspire to keep the two apart. David learns he is up against the agents of Fate itself¿the men of The Adjustment Bureau¿who will do everything in their considerable power to prevent David and Elise from being together. In the face of overwhelming odds, he must either let her go and accept a predetermined path¿or risk everything to defy Fate and be with her.

programme.title: Hanna (2011)
programme.desc: Hanna has lived most her life, with just her father Erik for company, in the remote far north of Scandinavia. Their hermit-like, self-sufficient existence is the result of a dark happening in Erik's former life as a CIA operative. If the Agency ever find him he will be killed - and so will his daughter. But now, aged 16, Hanna yearns for engagement with the world from which her father has determinedly kept her secluded. And, much to her surprise, and despite the immediate and extreme danger to which that will expose her, he accedes to her wish. However, it's not as though Hanna's not prepared: for as long as she can remember (and probably even before then), Erik has efficiently and expertly tutored his daughter in the craft of lethal self-defence and assassination. But will that be enough to save her from Marissa Wiegler, the ruthless CIA agent tasked with crossing them off her hit list? With Tom Hollander, Olivia Williams and Jason Flemyng.

Feature-length episode starring Martin Shaw as the 1960s Northumberland detective, with Lee Ingleby and Robert Glenister.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: A film star arrives from America and throws a summer garden party for the entire village of St Mary Mead - where one of her fans drinks a poisoned cocktail and promptly drops dead. Fortunately, the guest list includes Miss Marple, who immediately sets about tracking down the killer. Feature-length drama, starring Joan Hickson, Claire Bloom and Barry Newman.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Alan Davies' consulting detective returns to pit his inquiring mind against another festive mystery. According to a local legend, the house known as Daemons' Roost was once home to Jacob Surtees, a 19th-century sorcerer thought to have summoned the powers of Hell to terrorise and subjugate visitors. Now, it is home to Nathan Clore, an ailing film director with a dark secret, who has summoned his step-daughter Alison back home to impart to her the chilling truth of what happened to her mother and sister, who died in mysterious circumstances when she was just a child. However, mere days before Alison arrives, Nathan suffers a debilitating stroke, leaving him unable to shed any further light on the matter. Determined to get to the bottom of the mystery, Alison calls in old acquaintance Jonathan Creek to help. Also starring Sarah Alexander, Warwick Davis, Emun Elliott and Ken Bones.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Quirky crime drama. A housekeeper's assistant working for a celebrated crime writer becomes convinced she is losing her mind following a series of bizarre occurrences in his house. As master of illusion Jonathan and his intrepid sidekick Joey Ross puzzle over the strange events, they realise the mysterious death of a former resident in 1889, who apparently fell victim to the supernatural powers of his Egyptian employee, could hold the key. Starring Alan Davies, Sheridan Smith and guests Natalie Walter, Paul McGann, Sasha Behar and Ian McNeice.

programme.title: Girls Will Be Girls: The Culture Show:
programme.desc: At the height of the punk explosion almost 40 years ago, a handful of artists redefined the idea of women in music and radically altered the cultural landscape. In this programme, Miranda Sawyer meets Viv Albertine of the Slits, Chrissie Hynde of Pretenders, the Raincoats and punk fashion trailblazer Jordan to look at how they inspired a generation, and explores whether the era's spirit still survives.

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: Nick Huntley is brought in for questioning by AC-12, but denies any involvement in Steve's attack. However, the interrogation leads him to question how honest his wife has been with him. New anomalies emerge in the forensic evidence which cast further suspicion on Roz - who responds by dismantling the detectives' case with inside information of her own.

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: DCI Roz Huntley struggles to allay her husband's suspicions and AC12 find a new angle to pursue their case against her in the penultimate episode of Jed Mercurio's police drama.

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: Nick Huntley faces lengthy questioning before being charged with Tim Ifield's murder. The AC-12 team is convinced Roz was also involved, but with Hastings coming under pressure from Hilton, the detectives are running out of time to prove their theory, and are forced to risk everything to bring the guilty parties to justice. Concluding episode of the fourth season, starring Adrian Dunbar, Vicky McClure, Martin Compston and Thandie Newton.

programme.title: Yellowstone: The Blazing Summer
programme.desc: The arrival of summer in Yellowstone brings a new challenge for the beavers as their river dries up, forcing the colony to move. As food becomes scarce, the wolves have a surprising strategy to keep their pups fed, while grizzly bears pay an unexpected visit to a cowboy ranch. By midsummer, the hot and dry conditions create a new danger as deadly wildfires threaten to engulf a family of great grey owls. Presented by Kate Humble and Patrick Aryee. Last in the series.

programme.title: Hunters of the South Seas
programme.desc: Will Millard explores the Coral Triangle in the western Pacific, interacting with indigenous communities to learn how they have thrived in spite of their extreme isolation. In the village of Sampela, home to 1,500 Bajau people, Will lives with spear fisherman Kabei and his family in their small stilt house. He witnesses the Bajau's breathtaking skills in the water, learns how Kabei hasn't set foot on dry land for three years, and looks at what the future holds for this remarkable community.

programme.title: Trapped

Meanwhile, Asgeir has agreed to investigate the mystery of the dead animals Ketill has been finding up at the lake. In Icelandic and English.

programme.title: Trapped
programme.desc: The lake is found to be polluted and the town's water supply is turned off to prevent further cases of sickness. Under pressure to provide answers. programme.title: The Real Marigold on Tour
programme.desc: For their final adventure, Paul Nicholas and Rosemary Shrager are joined by comedy duo Ian and Janette Tough as they embark on a journey to Mexico. Beginning in the colourful city of Guadalajara, the group are keen to get to know their local surroundings, and enjoy a meal in a lively Mexican restaurant. The next day begins with a visit to a government funded institute for the elderly, before Rosemary and Paul decide to go and see one of Mexico's most popular spectator sports, wrestling. Finally, the group swap the streets of Guadalajara for the lakeside retirement mecca of Ajijic, and waste no time in throwing themselves into the local way of life, before reflecting on the two contrasting sides of Mexican retirement. Last in the series.

Her dinner-party guests are served butterflied leg of lamb and baby aubergines with oregano and roasted red onion, followed by meringue gelato cake with sharp raspberries and dark chocolate sauce for dessert.

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests look ahead to the weekend's matches, which include Arsenal v Manchester United and Crystal Palace v Brighton & Hove Albion.

programme.title: Rugby Union: Six Nations Build-Up
programme.desc: A look ahead to this weekend's fixtures, including Ireland v France, assessing the team selections and potential tactics that will be employed by each side.

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). John Inverdale introduces the opening match on the fourth weekend of fixtures, which takes place at Murrayfield. Scotland's recent record against Wales is nothing short of woeful and any hopes they had of making strides in this year's tournament have been hit by a combination of injuries to key players and a poor performance against Ireland in their last match here. Wales will be looking to keep their chances of winning the title alive before they head into their final fixture of the campaign, at home to Ireland next weekend. With commentary by Andrew Cotter, John Barclay, Chris Paterson and Martyn Williams, and analysis by Jeremy Guscott, Jonathan Davies, Sam Warburton and Andy Nicol.

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Another four famous faces try the famous black chair out for size. They are Horrible Histories actor Laurence Rickard, Springwatch presenter Martin Hughes-Games, model and presenter Vogue Williams and the BBC deputy political editor John Pienaar. John Humphrys asks the questions.

programme.title: Impossible Celebrities
programme.desc: Reverend Richard Coles and Pussycat Doll Kimberly Wyatt are among the 18 celebrities playing for charity in the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win money, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out. Rick Edwards hosts.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present as famous faces take part in the general knowledge quiz in which they try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public. Contestants include Kerry Howard, Neil Stuke, Robert Duncan, Susannah Doyle, Brigit Forsyth, James Baxter, Simon Greenall and Pauline McLynn.

programme.title: All Together Now
programme.desc: Rob Beckett hosts the musical talent show with a twist, as a range of singers step on-stage for a chance to win a £50,000 cash prize. The judging panel takes the form of `The 100', a large collective of music experts and performers from all over the UK. However, in this talent show, the key to success is encouraging the judges to sing along too, and the more panellists each singer manages to win over, the better their chances of proceeding to the grand final. This week's contestants perform tracks by Bruno Mars, Zayn Malik, Freddie Mercury and Shirley Bassey.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The aftermath of Iain's attempted suicide ripples its way through the emergency department. Gemma struggles to come to terms with what has happened, and makes it her mission to piece together why Ian attempted suicide. Meanwhile, wracked with guilt, Ruby goes out of her way for a patient, and Connie tells Elle off for addressing the team about Iain's progress.

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Newlyweds Dermot and Maria argue over whether they should buy their own home. Meanwhile, Grandad hopes to witness his own funeral, but Mrs Brown's plans go awry when she mistakes two Mormons - who have been stealing Father Quinn's parishioners - for the men who are supposed to be delivering the coffin.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Watford at the Etihad Stadium and Cardiff City v West Ham United at the Cardiff City Stadium. Watford have surpassed expectations once again this season, but victory over the defending champions at the Etihad would come as major surprise and a huge boost to title rivals Liverpool.

programme.title: Sam Warburton: Full Contact
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of the former Wales and British & Irish Lions captain, with unprecedented access to his home life, revealing the making of a rugby star. This documentary features revelations from Welsh head coach Warren Gatland, plus contributions by Ireland legend Brian O'Driscoll, England Rugby World Cup-winning former coach Clive Woodward and current Welsh star George North.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn and guests discuss the big political issues of the day.

programme.desc: Recorded coverage of House of Commons proceedings.

programme.desc: BBC Parliament simulcasts BBC Scotland's live coverage of proceedings at the Scottish Labour conference in Dundee, including the speech to conference by party leader Richard Leonard.

programme.title: Live Women's Six Nations
programme.desc: Ireland v France (Kick-off 7.00pm). Coverage of the match from the fourth round of fixtures, which takes place at Energia Park in Dublin.

programme.title: Asian Network Live 2019 - The Highlights
programme.desc: Asian Network Live brings you a massive night of live music from Arena Birmingham, featuring Mickey Singh, Jasmine Sandlas and Jaz Dhami.

programme.title: Better Things
programme.desc: Sam takes Max and her friend to a Joe Walsh concert where unexpected information is revealed. The actress's effort to get rid of an unwanted table prove difficult, but she does make some new friends from the experience.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Chris Clements investigates what is behind the UK's rising toll of drugs deaths, piecing together stories from a rural community where lives have been devastated by the growing abuse of prescription pills. The investigation reveals an illicit online trade in pills driven by social media.

programme.title: Humpback Whales: A Detective Story
programme.desc: In September 2015 in Monterey Bay California, a 30-ton humpback whale breached and landed on Tom Mustill and a friend as they paddled a sea kayak. Both survived the incident though the near-death experience left documentary-maker Tom wondering if the whale was deliberately trying to hurt them. Here, Tom returns to California to investigate that possibility, meeting others who have survived similar encounters and the experts who know the whales best. What Tom discovers raises far bigger questions, not just about what happened that day but also about man's relationship with whales.

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: All Over the Place: Asia
programme.desc: Ed Petrie and company swim with manta rays in Indonesia, visit a town devoted to Taekwondo in South Korea, and get messy during Holi, the Hindu Festival of Colours.

programme.title: Wild & Weird
programme.desc: Naomi Wilkinson and Tim Warwood examine a play date with a polar bear, a dolphin that thinks it is a sperm whale, and the ducklings with a cat for a mum.

programme.title: Absolute Genius with Dick & Dom
programme.desc: The work of Alexander Fleming, the scientist who discovered penicillin. Inspired by his ideas, the duo try to come up with their own, and attempt to turn germs into works of art.

programme.title: Top Class
programme.desc: Bolsover Church of England Junior School from Derbyshire take on Bowes Primary School from London in a first heat encounter to find the UK's smartest school. Susan Calman hosts.

programme.title: The Dog Ate My Homework
programme.desc: Host Iain Stirling is joined by child team captains Abdul and Sophie to battle it out in a series of challenges. Special guests Ivo Graham, Dr Ranj Singh, Lauren Layfield and Funmbi Omotayo compete in the hilarious rounds and challenges.

programme.title: Deadly on a Mission: Pole to Pole: Frozen North
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and the team travel to the American state of Alaska, where he abseils into the heart of a glacier and later gets the shock of his life when a humpback whale breaches metres from his boat. The crew then travels south to British Columbia, Canada, where Steve searches for the mysterious sixgill shark, and discovers a world of deadly critters underwater.

programme.title: Nature's Microworlds
programme.desc: Steve Backshall concludes his look at the planet's most fascinating ecosystems with a look at the Arctic archipelago of Svalbard. He reveals that it is home to an array of wildlife including the world's largest land predator, and uncovers a surprising secret about the remote region.

programme.title: Animal House: Natural World: Animal House
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates animals that build structures, including bower birds, which select mates based on their home decorations. He examines hornets that build electric central heating systems and the star-nosed mole, whose dwelling is designed to collect its preferred meal of worms.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore a large house in Dover in Kent, a house with issues in Camborne, Cornwall, and a two-bedroom flat in Woodford Green, Essex.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef embarks on another round of extended culinary breaks, visiting markets, restaurants, wineries, cafes and bars, beginning with Portuguese capital Lisbon. The culinary effects of Portugal's historic explorations are still seen in its dishes with hints of cinnamon and freshly chopped coriander from the east and tomatoes and chillies from the Americas. Rick is inspired to cook salt cod fritters and an almond tart, before heading for the St Anthony's Day Parade and Sardine Festival.

programme.title: Talking Pictures: Musicals
programme.desc: Looking at the Hollywood musical, with interviews from stars such as Fred Astaire and Julie Andrews, as well as discussion of films like Singin' in the Rain and The Sound of Music.

programme.title: Daddy Long Legs
programme.desc: Romantic musical comedy starring Fred Astaire and Leslie Caron. Captivated by a delightful French orphan, multi-millionaire Jervis Pendleton changes her life, but propriety demands he remains an anonymous benefactor, no matter what his heart dictates.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Nicholas Crane tells the tale of the Great Storm of 1703, which saw ships blown from British shores to Norway, while Ian McMillan discusses the fate of hospital ship Rohilla, which ran aground off Whitby, North Yorkshire, in 1914. Dick Strawbridge visits Tiree in the Inner Hebrides, where he explains how the timings of the D-Day landings were determined by RAF weather forecasters.

programme.title: Kangaroo Dundee & Other Animals - Part One: Natural World
programme.desc: The natural history documentary follows the work of tough Australian Chris `Brolga' Barnes, who has dedicated his life to rescuing and raising orphaned kangaroos in the outback near Alice Springs. This two-part film follows Brolga as he expands operations by opening his doors to a whole new bunch of animals, including a trio of camels, a southern hairy-nosed wombat and three emu chicks, as well as building a wildlife hospital.

programme.title: Mountain: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: The final episode focuses on life on the longest mountain range in the world, the Andes, home to astonishing hidden worlds, and extraordinary animals and people. Cameras follow a female puma and her three cubs as they hunt in the mountains of the frozen south, and the descendants of the Inca gather in an ancient ceremony to build a bridge made from woven grass. Last in the series.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The seven home sewers take on man-made fabrics designed for sport and the great outdoors, while the transformation challenge involves discarded festival tents. For the final assignment, male models arrive in the Sewing Room to be fitted with made-to-measure luxury tracksuits. Joe Lycett presents, while Esme Young and Patrick Grant pass judgment.

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: Five pairs of travellers - Sue and Clare, Felix and Josh, Natalie and Shameema, Jinda and Bindu, and Darron and Alex - set off from Greenwich, south-east London, passing through five checkpoints to reach their final destination of Singapore - without getting on a plane or using mobile phones or credit cards. Their first port of call is the ancient Greek city of Delphi. The stakes are high - everyone wants to be first to the finish line to win the cash prize.

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring organises a dance in an attempt to boost platoon morale - but Pike interrupts proceedings to make an important announcement regarding his girlfriend Violet. Classic comedy by Jimmy Perry and David Croft, starring Ian Lavender. First broadcast in 1969.

programme.title: The Lost City of Z
programme.desc: Period adventure based on a true story, starring Charlie Hunnam and Robert Pattinson. In the early 1900s, British explorer Percy Fawcett embarks on a quest through the Amazon jungle, meeting with intrigue and frustration as he attempts to uncover evidence of an ancient civilisation.

programme.title: Noah
programme.desc: Biblical epic starring Russell Crowe and Jennifer Connelly. Noah is sent a vision of the Earth covered in water, and decides to build an ark to survive a global flood. But he can't undertake such a task without help from fallen angels the Watchers, as the tribe led by the brutal Tubal-cain eyes his project enviously.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Million Pound Selfie Sell Off. Million Pound Selfie Sell Off
programme.desc: The rise of social media has brought with it a new kind of celebrity, the digital influencer. These megastars of Instagram and YouTube have upended the advertising industry by converting their virtual followers into real-world currency. Big-name brands have flocked to online stars, paying them millions to endorse their products, but the market has been criticised as being a 'Wild West' of misleading and unregulated advertising, plugging everything from bogus diet drinks to online gambling to young audiences. Panorama reporter Catrin Nye investigates whether companies are being up front and the impact this new form of advertising is having on consumers.

programme.desc: A marine is found with a gunshot wound six years after disappearing in Afghanistan, and the team discovers he vanished while carrying out an undercover operation. programme.desc: Feef's latest theory about the mole's identity is dismissed by Rowe, but when she uncovers a worrying rumour about Priscilla, he pressures her to break into her superior's office. Jarvis recalls being present at the birth of the United Nations, where a Russian aide let slip some shocking information, while Jackson begins to suspect that Jerry is dangerously unstable.

programme.title: Home
programme.desc: Peter Guest, his new partner Katy and her son John arrive back in Dorking, Surrey from their first holiday together. As they unpack the car, they are in for a big surprise. Somehow they must come to terms with the loss of their luggage, the arrival of something that will change their lives forever, and the chance of criminal charges for people smuggling. Comedy, written by and starring Rufus Jones, with Youssef Kerkour and Rebekah Staton.

programme.desc: Four amateur chefs compete for the £1,000 prize in north-west London. Solicitor Bahareh Amani, satellite-dish engineer Anil Patel, gardener Alan Stride and furniture delivery man Danny `Bulldog' Buckton take turns hosting dinner parties featuring belly dancing, pink stilettos and a traditional Indian menu.

programme.desc: In Berkshire, Amanda helps three house sellers give their homes a ready-to-market makeover in a bid to win an offer from buyer Ellie. Chris and Fiona must `de-chintz' their bedroom. Natalie and Oliver decide to remove the burlesque dancing pole from their bedroom and hide the lizards in the lounge, while Joey and Lisa look to banish the beige from their lounge.

programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free

Plus, mother-of-two Helen Wade has moved back to the UK after spending the last 14 years in France, and wants to turn her bedroom into not only a sanctuary for herself, but also use it as a workspace.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: When Doug and Carrie accidentally tape one of their arguments and play it back, they decide marriage counselling might be in order. To make things worse, Arthur gets hold of it and they become entertainment for a senior citizens' group. With Kevin James and Leah Remini.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie finds out that while they were dating, Doug lied to her about getting a job in the hope she would be more inclined to sleep with him. Starring Kevin James and Leah Remini.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra tries to create a sense of affection and familiarity by addressing Marie as `mom' - but the gesture backfires badly and offends her real mother, who finds it inappropriate.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part one of three. Marie gives Debra the silent treatment for being rude to her, so Ray talks the pair into making amends - but as usual in the Barone household, his efforts backfire. Starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Crane brothers are both invited to join a prestigious gentlemen's club - but unfortunately there is only a single vacancy available, meaning one of them is destined for disappointment. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.

programme.desc: The shrink worries he is being stalked by an unbalanced fan after receiving strange gifts with seemingly threatening messages attached. programme.desc: Leonard tries to get Sheldon into the Christmas mood by playing a game, but things do not go as planned when Sheldon reveals a childhood trauma. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is not pleased when his assistant Alex starts flirting with Leonard and has a word with her about it. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys become stranded in the middle of nowhere when Leonard's car is stolen en route to the Bakersfield comic-book convention. Meanwhile, back at home, the women try to work out why the guys are so fascinated with such publications.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer claims he encountered an extraterrestrial on a drunken walk home, prompting X-Files agents Mulder and Scully to investigate both him and the sighting. Featuring the guest voices of David Duchovny, Gillian Anderson and Leonard Nimoy.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge is kicked out of her ladies' investment club and responds by starting her own business selling hot pretzels - with a little help from Homer and local mob boss Fat Tony. Featuring the guest voices of Jack Lemmon and Joe Mantegna.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Updates on the story of property developer Jon Morgan, who called in an eviction specialist when the disused tram station he bought as an investment was taken over by squatters. Plus, a couple who rented out their home while they moved to America - only for their tenant to end up owing them £10,000 in back payments - and how a team from Peterborough Council came across a house with life-threatening electrics and some of the worst damp and mould they had ever seen.

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Caris prepares to remove a skin tag from the lower eyelid of a patient, whose demeanour takes a turn for the worse when the GP attempts to anaesthetise the area - a procedure that involves an injection just millimetres below the eyeball. A woman speaks to advanced nurse practitioner Linda about a blister on her daughter Holly's arm, which may be a sign that Holly's rare skin condition - scalded skin syndrome - has returned.

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Compilation of interior design tips from previous editions of the series, revealing how style guru Ann Maurice has helped homeowners sell their properties.

programme.title: Great Scientists

programme.title: Nick's Quest

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Middlesbrough man Michael opens a new type of bar for Benidorm, eschewing the usual cheap booze, cheap food and karaoke in favour of high-end drinks packages and funky house music. Can he pull in the punters? Power couple Wayne and Des plan a big party to thank Benidorm's show people for helping at a recent fundraiser, ex-criminal Rob and his partner Karen are struggling to keep their tattoo parlour afloat, and Scottish entrepreneur Kieran has noticed a gap in the motability market, using two-wheeled riding machines Segways for cheap sightseeing trips.

programme.title: The Queen Mum: The Reluctant Queen
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary exploring pivotal moments in the queen mother's life, starting with the tumultuous events of 1936. She began the year as Duchess of York, but following the abdication of her brother-in-law Edward VIII, her husband George was forced to take on the throne, leaving her unexpectedly thrust into the role of queen and a vital source of support for the unprepared new monarch.

programme.title: Angels & Demons

With the election of a new pope imminent, the Illuminati kidnap the four leading contenders and issue a coded message that they will murder the men and blow up the Vatican. Catholic leaders turn to Harvard symbolist Robert Langdon, who must put his uneasy relationship with the church hierarchy aside in an effort to crack the code and save the men's lives.

Meanwhile, the guys try to invent something of scientific importance - but only come up with new ways to procrastinate. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is driven to distraction when a tune becomes stuck in his head, while Amy and Dave arrange another date and Howard and Raj discover their band has a fan, but tracking him down turns out to be a mistake. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Mayim Bialik, Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After more than five years of dating, Sheldon and Amy spend their first night together, while Leonard, Howard and Raj must decide who will take their extra Star Wars movie ticket. Plus, Sheldon's Obi-Wan advises him on his difficult relationship decisions. Starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with recurring guest star Bob Newhart.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets more than she bargained for when Leonard agrees to meet a psychiatrist on her behalf, while Sheldon and Raj collaborate on an astronomical discovery. Stuart moves out, but Howard and Bernadette's happiness is short-lived. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy are thrilled when their super-asymmetry theory is proved correct by two physicists from Chicago - until the experts try to exclude Amy from their Nobel Prize nomination. Bernadette experiences a big success at work and plans for Penny to become a part of it - whether she wants to or not.

programme.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Sci-fi action adventure starring James Franco and Freida Pinto. When scientist Will Rodman's programme of drug experiments to find a cure for Alzheimer's disease is shut down he secretly takes an offspring from one of the chimpanzees he was using into his home and names him Caesar. Caesar has inherited the effects of the trial drug and begins to show remarkable intelligence, a development that will put him on a violent collision course with the humans who have abused him.

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Jason Statham and Shu Qi. Frank Martin is a professional driver who moves goods around for shady clients with no questions asked. When his latest cargo turns out to be a beautiful Asian woman, Martin is forced to break his own code and go on the run from his ruthless employers.\n.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The nation's favourite armchair critics share their opinions on what they watched during November, 2015. Programmes eliciting their instant reactions and lively - sometimes emotional - discussions include The X Factor, Colour: The Spectrum of Science, I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, Simply Nigella, The Hunt, First Dates and the news.

programme.title: American Mary
programme.desc: A medical student is short of cash, and increasingly disenchanted with her profession and the surgeons she once idolised. Needing some extra cash to make ends meet, she begins performing dangerous procedures in the sinister world of illegal underground surgeries. Thriller, starring Katharine Isabelle and Antonio Cupo.

programme.title: Ever After: a Cinderella Story
programme.desc: Romantic fantasy based on the fairy tale, starring Drew Barrymore, Anjelica Huston and Dougray Scott. Since the death of her father eight years earlier, Danielle has been treated as a servant by her stepmother Baroness Rodmilla. But could an encounter with the dashing Prince Henry change Danielle's life for ever?

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure based on Susan Cooper's award-winning The Dark Is Rising novels, starring Alexander Ludwig and Christopher Eccleston. The Christmas holidays end early for schoolboy Will Stanton when he discovers that he is the Seeker,the last in a line of immortal warriors who have dedicated their lives to fighting the evil Rider and the powers of the Dark.\n.

programme.title: Ice Age 4: Continental Drift
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure featuring the voices of Ray Romano, Denis Leary and John Leguizamo. When they are cast adrift on an iceberg, Manny, Diego and Sid embark on a journey to a new world where they encounter fantastic sea creatures but fall foul of the evil pirate Captain Gutt and his crew.

programme.title: Johnny English
programme.desc: Comedy adventure starring Rowan Atkinson, and featuring John Malkovich. When the crown jewels are stolen from under the nose of the authorities, bumbling secret agent Johnny English is assigned to retrieve them and capture the culprits. The unfortunate spy is soon in over his head when he discovers that the theft is part of an evil plan to seize the British throne.

programme.title: Fighting with My Family Interview Special

programme.title: Night at the Museum (2006)
programme.desc: Larry has lots of ideas and dreams, but none of them come to fruition. In an attempt to prove his stability to his ex-wife and his son Nicky, Larry accepts a job as a night guard at the Museum of Natural History. But the elderly night guards who hire him fail to mention one crucial detail: when the museum is closed, everything inside comes to life...

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian (2009)
programme.desc: Shawn Levy's fantasy-adventure sequel again stars Ben Stiller and some impressive CGI effects. It's two years on from the original outing and former museum nightwatchman Larry Daley (Stiller) is now a successful businessman. His commercial venture has kept him so busy that he's not had time to visit his secret chums at New York's Natural History Museum. And when he does finally make it, he discovers that many of them have been packed up and sent off for storage at the Smithsonian in Washington. Then Daley gets a call from Jebediah, one of the exhibits dispatched to Washington, to say that the evil Pharaoh Kahmunrah plans to take over the Smithsonian. Obviously, Daley has no choice but to dash to the capital and help his friends to quash the megalomaniac's plans...

Seventies comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Richard Briers.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney mourn Grandad's death, and feel gratified to see such a good turn-out of friends and relatives at his funeral - even if most people are more interested in the food afterwards. However, one of the guests, a certain long-lost seafaring uncle, ends up outstaying his welcome. Long-running comedy, introducing Buster Merryfield to the cast as Uncle Albert.

programme.desc: Rodney aspires to be a pop star, taking on the role of the drumless drummer in Mental Mickey's band but, not surprisingly, Del-Boy manages to ruin his chances. With a guest appearance by DJ Mike Read, alongside David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: PGA Tour Champions Golf
programme.desc: Hoag Classic second-round play from Newport Beach (Cal.) Country Club. Vijay Singh was last year's winner of this event, which dates back to 1995.

programme.title: There's Something About Mary (1998)
programme.desc: After Dumb and Dumber and Kingpin, this was the Farrelly brothers' breakthrough movie, an all-round, laugh-out-loud comedy of bad taste, leavened by stand-out performances from a top-notch cast. Ben Stiller plays high school geek Ted, invited to the prom by the gorgeous Mary. He can hardly believe his luck; but the night goes wrong when he arrives to pick up his date, and has a painful accident in the toilet, failing to stow his tackle before zipping up. Thirteen years later Ted still yearns for what might have been and hires private eye Pat Healy to find Mary. The detective succeeds but also falls for her and feeds Ted false information so he can keep her for himself. But a suspicious Ted takes matters into his own hands and finds he's in the middle of a love pentagon also involving an architect and an NFL quarterback. With the addition of gags involving a speed-freaked dog, Mary's use of what she believes is Ted's hair gel and a minstrel troupe who follow Ted around, the resulting comedy may not be subtle but is very funny.

programme.title: Ghosts of Girlfriends Past (2009)
programme.desc: Successful fashion photographer and confirmed womanizer Connor Mead (Matthew McConaughey) has learned everything he knows about women from his deceased uncle Wayne (Michael Douglas). As his brother is about to get married, Connor takes a break from his playboy lifestyle to attend the ceremony not without first trying to convince his sibling of the enormous mistake he is about to make. After a drunken speech at the rehearsal dinner, Connor meets in the bathroom the ghost of Uncle Wayne, who surprisingly shows his regret and tells his nephew that, over the course of the evening, he'll be visited by three ghosts who will lead him through his romantic past, present, and future. Will this be Connor¿s big chance to get over himself and find true love?

programme.title: Valentine's Day (2010)
programme.desc: Valentine's Day. It comes every year whether we like it or not. It's the day when our love lives are put on display. There's always a chance for romance or disaster. It can be confusing, complicated, but at the end of the day, it's all about love.

programme.title: Valentine's Day (2010)
programme.desc: Valentine's Day. It comes every year whether we like it or not. It's the day when our love lives are put on display. There's always a chance for romance or disaster. It can be confusing, complicated, but at the end of the day, it's all about love.

programme.title: Inherent Vice (2014)
programme.desc: In this offbeat detective story set in 1970 California, a drug-addled private eye investigates a conspiracy involving his ex-flame and her married, real-estate-developer boyfriend. Meanwhile, various eccentric characters complicate the investigation.

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop (1995)
programme.desc: Fact-based tale about GIs in Vietnam who volunteer to corral an elephant for a village's ceremonial ritual.

programme.title: The Prince & Me (2004)
programme.desc: Edvard, Crown Prince of Denmark, secretly comes to study in America. He's smitten by Paige, a no-nonsense country girl determined to become a doctor. Eventually, they click - but what happens when she finds out who he really is?

programme.title: Spies Like Us (1985)
programme.desc: Two misfit low-level CIA agents are turned into decoys by their superiors and sent to Pakistan to distract Soviet agents from discovering the genuine American spies in the area. However, the two bumbling buddies end up making more of a difference in the cold war than anyone expects.

programme.title: The Lost Boys (1987)
programme.desc: A single mom and her two sons move to a new town that turns out to be home to a group of teen vampires. After the older brother is turned into a bloodsucker, the younger brother teams with two guys who work a local comic-book store to save him.

programme.title: Life of the Party (2018)
programme.desc: When long-term housewife Deanna suddenly finds herself single, she decides to go back to college against the wishes of her daughter. Exploring the unknown world of campus life, Deanna embraces the freedom she never had, and discovers her true self in the process.

programme.title: Jack the Bear (1993)
programme.desc: Following his wife's death, an alcoholic TV host struggles to raise his sons.

programme.title: She's Funny That Way (2014)
programme.desc: A married Broadway director implores a call girl-turned-actress to turn her life around while the star of his latest production makes a play for his wife in this ensemble comedy.

programme.title: American Loser (2007)
programme.desc: An aimless slacker runs out of options when he gets kicked out of his home, but he soon moves in with a woman whom he met at a support group for people with relationship problems. Eventually, she inspires him to get his life together.

programme.title: Sorority Boys (2002)
programme.desc: If Mel Gibson had to get inside the mind of women to respect and understand them, in this teenage film the main characters will have to dress up as such to be able to do the same. Adam, Dave and Doofer are three college students who, after being thrown out of their brotherhood, find refuge in a neighboring sisterhood, made up of… feminists. To secure their space there they must dress up and keep a low profile. Until now, they had been cruel to girls, but this soon changes.

programme.title: The Cheshire Murders (2013)
programme.desc: A chronicle of a 2007 home invasion in Cheshire, Conn., that resulted in arson and the deaths of a mother and her two daughters.

programme.title: Date Night (2010)
programme.desc: Tina Fey and Steve Carell star in Shawn Levy's chase comedy. Phil and Claire Foster feel their marriage has gone a tad stale and decide to pep it up by going out on a date, just like they used to do, before the kids and the mortgage and rest of life's inevitable distractions got in the way. In principal it's a good idea, but their first mistake is to attempt entry into one of Manhattan's swankiest restaurants without a reservation. Their second is far more serious: they bluff their way in, pretending to be a couple who have failed to show up for their table. Unfortunately for the Fosters, the absent diners have serious gangland connections. Even more unfortunately, the people whose identities they've adopted are due to be silenced forever by Mob hitmen. Cue a tightly plotted, gag-packed, headlong flight for survival, which has distinct echoes of the classics of the 40s screwball genre. And keep an eye out for memorable cameos from Mark Wahlberg and James Franco.

programme.title: Big Fish (2003)
programme.desc: A chronicle of the life of Edward Bloom, a garrulous Southerner whose tall tales have always alienated his no-nonsense son, Will. But with Edward near death, Will must come to terms with his father and his stories before it's too late.

programme.title: The Many Lives Of Nick Buoniconti (2019)
The Many Lives Of Nick Buoniconti (2019)
Man on Fire (2004)
programme.desc: Bloody revenge saga about a disgraced intelligence agent-turned-bodyguard who becomes a one-man army when the girl he's protecting is kidnapped.

programme.title: Down a Dark Hall (2018)
programme.desc: A short-tempered young girl is sent to a mysterious boarding school run by an intense headmistress. The girl, Kit, meets and befriends her only other schoolmates, also four troubled girls, and as they explore their new surroundings they discover the school harbors a dark secret.

programme.title: Love Potion No. 9 (1992)
programme.desc: Two nerdy scientists become irresistible after drinking a palm reader's secret formula.

programme.title: Wonder Woman (2017)
programme.desc: An Amazon princess's idyllic life on an island occupied only by woman warriors is interrupted when a pilot crash-lands nearby. After rescuing him, she learns that World War I is engulfing the planet, and vows to use her superhuman powers to restore peace.

programme.title: It's a Hard Truth, Ain't It (2018)
programme.desc: Inmates at Indiana's Pendleton Correctional Facility study documentary filmmaking as a vehicle to explore their memories from childhood to incarceration, and alternate roles in front of and behind the camera to reflect on their crimes and sentences.

programme.title: Knight and Day (2010)
programme.desc: A single woman and a spy race to elude a federal agent and uncover the truth about a clandestine mission gone awry. Meanwhile, a CIA director attempts to discover why the unlikely duo have taken flight. Extended edition.

programme.title: Grey Gardens (2009)
programme.desc: A docudrama about Big Edie and Little Edie, the aunt and cousin of Kennedy-Onassis respectively. The reclusive socialites made headlines when the health department threatened to raid their dilapidated East Hampton, N.Y., mansion in the early 1970s.

programme.title: He's Just Not That Into You (2009)
programme.desc: An adaptation of a best-selling self-help book, 'He's Just Not That Into You' follows the story of a group who tries to sort out the signals that the sexes exchange. Gigi (Ginnifer Goodwin) imagines every man she meets is Mr. Right. She gets advice from a bar owner (Justin Long) who prides himself on understanding the ins and outs of the dating scene. Her friend Janine (Jennifer Connelly) seems to have a solid marriage with Ben (Bradley Cooper). Until he meets the attractive Anna (Scarlett Johansson), who's indifferent to Conor's (Kevin Connolly) pursuits. programme.desc: In a First World War special, Suggs and Stephen Taylor excavate the site of a huge transit camp at Morn Hill, outside Winchester, home to over two million troops, travelling from all over the Empire to the Western Front. They find an array of artefacts from 100 years ago, including dog-tags from British and American soldiers - one of whom they track all the way to his living relative. Also unearthed are iron heels from hobnail boots, cap badges and steel fixings for epaulettes from the 23rd London Regiment, bayonets from Lee Enfield 303s and many more intriguing artefacts such as a condom tin.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go! To the Movies (2018)
programme.desc: When Hollywood starts making blockbuster movies about all of their super-peers like Batman, Wonder Woman and Superman, the Teen Titans realize that the world doesn't consider them "real" heroes worthy of gracing the big screen. Robin, Cyborg, Beast Boy, Raven and Starfire decide to prove themselves by declaring super villain Slade their arch-nemesis and vowing to stop his plan to take over the world.

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief (2010)
programme.desc: (2010) This family adventure from Chris Columbus (who directed the first two Harry Potter films) is adapted from the first of Rick Riordan's series of fantasy novels, and stars Logan Lerman as Percy Jackson, an American teen who finds that Greek myth is much closer to home than he imagined. It turns out that while his mum Sally (Catherine Keener) is human, his father (Kevin McKidd) is the Greek god of the sea and earthquakes, Poseidon; which makes our hero a demigod. At first it's all a bit much to take in, as he learns the modern world is teeming with deities and their offspring. And things take a turn for the worse when Zeus (Sean Bean) suspects Percy of theft after the lightning bolt that confers supreme, terrifying power goes missing. With his mother kidnapped and the errant super weapon threatening to cause a catastrophic clash of the gods, Percy sets off to recover the artefact. As he does so, he discovers the many creatures and monsters of legend are also alive today, and are as fierce as ever. Also starring Pierce Brosnan (as a centaur), Uma Thurman (as Medusa) and Steve Coogan (as Hades).

programme.title: Where the Heart Is (2000)
programme.desc: While traveling to California with her boyfriend, a pregnant teen is abandoned at an Oklahoma Wal-Mart. She decides to stay, and makes a temporary home in the store while pondering her future.

programme.title: Clash of the Titans (2010)
programme.desc: In this fantasy adventure based on Greek mythology, a courageous warrior named Perseus vows to defeat Hades in order to prevent the god of the underworld from overthrowing Zeus, thereby turning Earth into a living hell. A man of godly origins, Perseus watched in agony as Hades took his family, but now, with a small band of warriors by his side, he battles mythical creatures while tapping into his god-like abilities to take control of his own fate.

programme.title: Deadpool 2 (2018)
programme.desc: In order to protect a young boy from a dangerous time-travelling mercenary named Cable, wise-cracking anti hero Deadpool puts together the X-Force, a group of misfit mutant superheroes. Together, the unlikely team must do everything in their power to keep the child safe.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives

programme.title: Disappeared

programme.title: Disappeared

programme.title: Murder Shift

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three murder investigations involving poison, including arsenic and potassium chloride - one of which requires toxicology tests on frozen tissue from the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives

Game show, hosted by Phillip Schofield.

programme.title: Catchphrase

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 4.45pm). The fourth round of fixtures continues with this encounter at Twickenham, where England start as overwhelming favourites to prevail. This is the 25th meeting between the nations since they first met in 1991 and England maintain a 100% record in that time. That statistic seems unlikely to come under threat this year, as Eddie Jones continues to build his squad ahead of the World Cup, while Italy have failed to make any great strides recently and sit in their customary place at the bottom of the table. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Lawrence Dallaglio, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield, Marco Bortolami and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and Ugo Monye.

programme.title: Small Fortune
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Dermot O'Leary, in which teams of three take on challenges in miniature settings. Last in the series.

However, even if the judge who selected an act decides to let them go, they still have a chance to stay in the game if they can convince one of the others to take them on.

But the authorities also have their mole, and a deadly game of cat and mouse ensues as both men struggle to conceal their true identity. \n.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A mischievous trickster finally gets his comeuppance when his body is found floating below the weir in Midsomer Deverell. programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a family glassware business collapses following the death of one of its partners, Barnaby investigates allegations of financial irregularities, love triangles and a string of murders. Lapsed Freemason Jones uses his inside knowledge to explore the ceremonial aspects of two killings, but it is Cully's production of Hamlet that gives Tom the key to the mystery. John Nettles, Jason Hughes, Jane Wymark and Laura Howard star.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is delighted that his heroes Hired Gun are reuniting to play at the Midsomer Rocks festival - minus their drummer, who disappeared 30 years ago after driving his car into a quarry. However, a string of bizarre warnings convinces the paranoid lead singer that someone is trying to stop the reunion, and his fears are confirmed when the backing singer drops dead on stage. Radio 2 host Suzi Quatro guest stars.

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A professor feels humiliated when her internet dating video is leaked onto a website and watched by her students. The next morning she is found dead, the victim of what appears to be a straightforward suicide. However, Lewis is not convinced and digs deeper, identifying several suspects including the site's founder - but as he and Hathaway get closer to the truth amid a rising death toll, they find their personal and professional lives dredged up online for all to see. Guest starring Roxanne McKee (Game of Thrones) and Toby Stephens (Die Another Day), with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox.

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective investigates after a botanist accidentally unearths the body of a recently buried professor who was fixated upon solving a seemingly impossible riddle by Lewis Carroll. The victim had a long-standing rivalry with his brother - giving Lewis and Hathaway an obvious suspect - but the case is hindered by the mind games of two students who seem intent on causing trouble in their quest to gain admittance to a mysterious club. Guest starring Celia Imrie and James Fleet, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox.

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A visiting American academic delivers a controversial speech, with many audience members worried his ideas could be used to target ethnic minorities. So when he is found hanged the next morning and Dr Hobson quickly discounts suicide, Lewis and Hathaway realise they have many suspects - from the local anti-racism activist who was first in voicing her disgust at the professor's beliefs to the women who had bombarded him with threatening e-mails. But then another body turns up and the case takes on a new dimension. David Soul and Patrick Baladi guest star.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Former nanny Lavinia Seagram is found soaked in blood and it is believed she had turned to drink and drugs to commit suicide. However, Poirot is soon on the scent of troubled heiress Norma Restarick, who had problems of her own - not least confessing to the possibility she has killed someone herself. Guest starring Jemima Rooper, Zoe Wanamaker and Peter Bowles, with David Suchet as the Belgian sleuth.

programme.desc: Biologist and extreme angler Jeremy Wade travels to the heart of Africa journeying along the Congo, a river shrouded in mystery and steeped in legend. While exploring the tale of Mami Wata, a spirit that is said to lure fishermen from their boats to the bottom of the river, where they are imprisoned for eternity, he discovers the truth is every bit as frightening as the myth.

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: Elizabeth at 90 - A Family Tribute
programme.desc: A unique celebration of the Queen's 90 years, using Her Majesty's personal collection of home movies, shot by Prince Philip, King George VI, the Queen Mother and the Queen herself, to build a picture of her life. Various members of the royal family are shown watching this private footage and contribute their own personal insights and memories of the woman they know as both close family member and as Queen. Those taking part include Prince Charles, Prince William, Prince Harry, Princess Anne, the Duke of Kent and Princess Alexandra, who has never before given an interview.

One is there to uncover a medieval wall painting in the local church and the other to search for an unmarked grave. As the summer passes, both men come to terms with the experiences that have scarred them both.

programme.title: Boys in Brown

programme.desc: Documentary chronicling life at Gascoigne Primary School in Barking, east London, following the pupils, parents and staff. Lee, also 10, has moved from Norfolk after the death of his mother and is disrupting classes to get attention, while newly qualified teacher Kevin McNally has to cope with a class that is constantly changing.

programme.desc: Sheridan Smith stars in this drama based on the blog and book by Lisa Lynch, an account of her life after being diagnosed with breast cancer. Twenty-eight-year-old Lisa's life is going exactly the way she wanted - she has recently married the man of her dreams and her career is on the up. Then out of the blue, she receives a shocking a diagnosis from the doctor that threatens to stop her in her tracks. Right from the start, however, Lisa is determined not to let cancer change her, and begins to write about her experience - unaware of the effect it will have on her life and that of others. Paul Nicholls, Haydn Gwynne and Michael Maloney co-star.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Newbury Park in southern California to help Mexican restaurant Mama Rita's. The owner previously ran a successful catering company but has struggled to adapt her skills to meet the demands of a new business - and with a year's worth of food stored in the freezer Gordon realises he has a tough job ahead.

programme.title: The Good Fight
programme.desc: Diane and Lucca represent an ovarian cancer survivor looking to obtain custody of her previously donated embryos. Meanwhile, Maia becomes the victim of a fake social media account, and Mike Kresteva pays a visit to Reddick, Boseman and Kolstad. Drama, starring Christine Baranski and Rose Leslie.

programme.title: Jamie's Comfort Food: Curried Fish Pie
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver gives another of the nation's favourite dishes a twist, turning his attention to a curried fish pie.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps newlyweds Maurice and Lorraine as they search for a property in the Turks and Caicos Islands in the Caribbean, with a budget of £425,000.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton advises Christine and Richard Turley, who are seeking to buy a holiday home in Portugal that they can share with their families. Working with a budget of £190,000, Laura shows them five properties close to the beaches of the Western Algarve, but will any meet their exacting standards?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Lynn and Brett Merritt from Hampshire fell in love with laid-back Cape Verde the moment they stepped off the plane on their first visit, and have been dreaming of buying a holiday home there ever since. Jasmine Harman shows them five properties on this stunning speck in the Atlantic within their £55,000 budget.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the East Midlands, meeting two sets of first-time buyers for whom time is of the essence. Kirstie is in Leicester with Karen and Mike, who need to find a home that is also a good investment for Mike's inheritance. In Northamptonshire, Phil is searching for Tom and Claudia, who are expecting a baby in four weeks. This creative couple need a place big enough not only to start a family and work from home, but to keep a goat in the garden.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with couples who between them saw more than 40 properties during their house search. Anna and Mikey wanted a classic tenement flat in Glasgow's popular West End. In the Thames Valley, Hemani and Nigel were just back from Australia and struggling to adjust to the size of British homes. Phil follows up on the twists and turns in their lives since they last met.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Ye Olde Fighting Cocks in Arnside, Cumbria, where owners Tony Keates and Jeanette Hamer hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money. However, while the B&B's guests are bowled over by the spectacular views, they are less than impressed by Tony's tales of business success and a mouldy mattress.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Hadleigh, Suffolk, where Dr Stephen Stanley-Little invites fellow B&B owners to come and stay at his tranquil country setting - Westward Cottage. He takes his guests on a historic village tour that leaves one couple plotting their escape, while the host's relaxed approach to breakfast drives some of the others mad.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host are bohemian couple Avril Berry and Alan Fraser of Roulotte Retreat in Melrose on the Scottish borders. Their unique gypsy caravans are not to everyone's liking, and a yoga class fails to calm the tensions that seem to be rising within the group.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Elgin Hotel, Blackpool, where manager Garry Lloyd and his daughter Sophie Seddon want to demonstrate how their 89-room business can still deliver a personal touch. The hosts arrange an afternoon of tap-dancing lessons, ending with a surprise performance at the iconic Grand Theatre, but a breakfast mix-up the following morning puts some of the guests nonplussed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Logistics supervisor Michelle hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in and around Aberdeen, hoping her night impresses guests Turid, Naz, Sylvian and David.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Economics undergraduate David hosts on night two in Aberdeen, and the 1920s Gatsby-themed dress code goes down a storm with almost everyone.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Comedy promoter Naz hosts the fourth evening in Aberdeen - but if he has any chance of winning, he will have to placate his guests, nearly all of whom he has offended this week.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Japan's Tsunami: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Amateur footage and eyewitness accounts telling the story of the earthquake and subsequent tsunami that caused devastation in Japan in March 2011. The film also discovers how the country dealt with the aftermath of these natural disasters, as people struggled to rebuild their lives and communities.

programme.title: Japan's Tsunami: How It Happened
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the scientific factors behind the magnitude nine earthquake and the resultant tsunami that struck Japan on March 11, 2011. Professor of geological sciences Roger Bilham views the effects of the devastation from the air, and journalist Callum Macrae travels to the north of the country, where survivors in the fishing villages of Sendai and Ofunato are struggling to cope in the aftermath.

programme.title: Countryside 999

programme.title: Keiser Report
programme.desc: Markets! Finance! Scandal! Keiser Report is a no holds barred look at the shocking scandals behind the global financial headlines. From the collusion between Wall Street and Capitol Hill to the latest banking crime wave, from bogus government economic statistics to rigged stock markets, nothing escapes the eye of Max Keiser, a former stockbroker, inventor of the virtual specialist technology and co-founder of the Hollywood Stock Exchange. With the help of Keiser's co-host, Stacy Herbert, and guests from around the world, Keiser Report tells you what is really going on in the global economy.

programme.desc: Scotland v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Coverage of the opening match on the fourth weekend of fixtures, which takes place at Murrayfield. programme.title: The Hunted (2003)
programme.desc: A rogue special-forces soldier is tracked down by his former mentor in this action thriller starring Benicio del Toro stars as Aaron Hallam, one of the U.S. military's most skilled hand-to-hand combat operatives. In the years following his successful assassination of a Serbian warlord in late-'90s Kosovo, Hallam finds himself plagued by traumatic flashbacks of death and destruction, so much so that when he finally returns home, he regresses into a feral, survivalist state in the woods of the Pacific Northwest. There, he deliberately and elaborately hunts and kills poachers who happen to cross his path. When the FBI investigates the murders, they call in the man who taught Hallam everything he knows: retiree L.T. Bonham (Tommy Lee Jones). As the instructor pursues his unhinged former pupil, Bonham begins to learn about key events in Hallam's life that pushed him over the edge.

programme.title: Showtime Boxing Special Edition
programme.desc: Regis Prograis (20-0, 17 KOs) takes on Julius Indongo (22-1, 11 KOs) in a super-lightweight bout in Deadwood, S.D.

programme.title: 68 Kill (2017)
programme.desc: A couple plot to steal $68,000 from their trailer-park landlord, but their scheme quickly backfires. Faced with dead bodies and frightened captives, they end up traveling down a path that seems to lead to their own demise.

programme.title: 68 Kill (2017)
programme.desc: A couple plot to steal $68,000 from their trailer-park landlord, but their scheme quickly backfires. Faced with dead bodies and frightened captives, they end up traveling down a path that seems to lead to their own demise.

programme.title: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! (1988)
programme.sub-title: From the Files of Police Squad!
programme.desc: From the team that brought the game-changing comedy Airplane! to the screen (director David Zucker, writers Jerry and David Zucker and Jim Abrahams) comes the original Naked Gun (which spawned two sequels), with Leslie Nielsen as Lt Frank Drebin. Drebin foils a plot by arch-criminal Victor Ludwig (Ricardo Montalban) to assassinate our own dear Queen (Jeannette Charles) at a Los Angeles Dodgers baseball game. He's helped by Ludwig's assistant Jane Spencer (Priscilla Presley) who has no idea of the dastardly plan and soon agrees to help Drebin, as well as falling in love with him. The plot is paper-thin but the laughs come hot on the heels of each other, made all the funnier by the straight playing of all the leads. Cameo appearances include Orson Welles' collaborator John Houseman and baseball legend Reggie Jackson.

programme.title: The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear (1991)
programme.desc: “Frank Drebin Is Back. Just Accept It” runs the tagline for this follow-up to the smash hit original as Leslie Nielsen reprises the role of totally fearless and totally stupid cop Lt Frank Drebin. This time, he uncovers a plot by the polluting energy giants to de-rail ecological plans that could render their products redundant. They're led by the evil Quentin Hapsburg who, to make matters worse, is romancing Frank's ex, Jane Spencer. But that's enough of the plot; David Zucker's film (which he co-scripted with Jim Abrahams) contains sight and script gags galore, with Nielsen and the rest of the cast playing it straight down the line amid the comedic mayhem.

programme.title: Naked Gun 33 1/3: The Final Insult (1994)
programme.desc: Peter Segal directs the third film in the Naked Gun comedy franchise, but the script is once again by Jim Abrahams and David Zucker, and Leslie Nielsen returns as Lt Frank Drebin, persuaded out of retirement to thwart a plot to bomb the Oscars ceremony by terrorist Rocco Dillon. As ever, the one-liners and sight gags come thick and fast, as the cast play it completely straight.

programme.title: Muhammad Ali: The Greatest. Of All Time. (2017)
programme.desc: Muhammad Ali talks a suicidal stranger down from a ledge, using his unique brand of wit and wisdom.

programme.title: Friday Night Lights (2004)
programme.desc: The American dream, in the real-life story of a dream team of American... football, of course. Billy Bob Thornton plays Gary Gaines, a coach that began to train a team for a high school tournament and took it to the top. Set in a Texan town, dispirited by the recession, this film - by the actor and rising director, Peter Berg - covers not only the team's progress in the sport, but also the stories of immigrants and social problems surrounding the game and its main figures.

programme.title: Equilibrium (2002)
programme.desc: Following a cataclysmic world war, the leading world powers outlaw emotion, believing that doing so will reduce the chances of another conflict. Thought-police known as Clerics are sent to enforce the law and put offenders to death. When one Cleric accidentally misses a dose of the drug which suppresses his emotions, he begins to reconsider his role in the fight against expression.

programme.title: Bull Durham (1988)
programme.desc: A minor-league catcher and a baseball groupie team to help a talented young pitcher make it to the big leagues, and fall in love in the process.

programme.title: High Plains Drifter (1973)
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood's first Western as both director and star is a revenge tale that centers on a mysterious stranger who rides into a lakefront settlement, where the citizens beg him to defend them against a group of outlaws who have a score to settle with the townsfolk.

programme.title: Jackie Brown (1997)
programme.desc: Quentin Tarantino's slick, complex crime story is spun around a hard-bitten flight attendant (Pam Grier) trying to outsmart a smarmy gunrunner (Samuel L. Jackson). Based on an Elmore Leonard novel. Louis: Robert De Niro. Melanie: Bridget Fonda. Ray: Michael Keaton.

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds (2009)
programme.desc: Quentin Tarantino's history-tweaking homage to the war movie sees the director back on exhilarating form. American officer Aldo Raine leads a squad of soldiers into occupied France on a Dirty-Dozen-style assassination mission to kill as many Nazis as possible and spread fear through the Third Reich. They become involved in a Jewish resistance fighter's plan to blow up the Parisian premiere of one of Goebbels' propaganda films - an event due to be attended by Hitler himself. Inglourious Basterds features the entertainingly showy performances, encyclopaedic movie references and oodles of self-conscious dialogue that you'd expect from a Tarantino film, as well as a superb turn from Christoph Waltz as a charmingly evil SS colonel. In English, and German, French and Italian with English subtitles.

programme.title: Midnight Sun (2018)
programme.desc: A sheltered girl named Katie has a rare disease that makes exposure to sunlight deadly. A chance encounter with her childhood crush, Charlie, leads to an unlikely summer romance that gets complicated when Katie finally reveals her medical condition.

programme.title: Mary Shelley (2018)
programme.desc: When 16-year-old writer Mary Wollstonecraft meets the poet Percy Shelley, the two instantly begin a whirlwind romance. As their relationship deepens and hits rough patches, Mary finds the inspiration for her novel “Frankenstein.”.

programme.title: The Mexican (2001)
programme.desc: Academy award nominated megastar Brad Pitt stars alongside Academy Award winning beauty Julia Roberts in this fun-filled romantic comedy packed with adventure. A clumsy criminal is put in a position where he not only has to save his own skin, but that of his girlfriend in this comedy with strong undercurrents of romance. Jerry Welbach (Pitt) is a low-level Mafia "mechanic" whose ineptitude is countered by frequent (but unpredictable) bursts of dumb luck. Jerry's girlfriend Samantha (Roberts) wants him to get out of the business, and after his latest blunder lands capo Arnold Margolese (Gene Hackman) in jail, so does mid-level crime kingpin Bernie Nayman (Bob Balaban). But Bernie insists that Jerry do one last errand for the mob before they let him find employment elsewhere -- he has to go to Mexico and recover a rare and very valuable pistol, which is said to be cursed. While Samantha objects to Jerry taking the assignment, he isn't in much of a position to argue; Jerry heads south of the border, while Samantha, in a huff, sets out for Las Vegas. Once in Mexico, Jerry finds the pistol easily enough, but making his way back to the States proves to be an unexpected challenge.

programme.title: No Way Out (1986)
programme.desc: A Naval Officer who slept with the US Secretary of Defense's mistress is tasked with rooting the KGB mole accused of murdering her, but realizes that he has become a pawn in an elaborate cover up to protect the murderous politician.

programme.desc: A recently separated woman moves to L.A. with her two daughters, where she rents out her guesthouse to three much-younger men—one of whom she soon begins dating. Her new life gets even more complicated when her estranged husband reenters the picture.

Although he's miserable dealing with the stupid customers and bratty kids, he falls in love with one of his coworkers, Em (Kristen Stewart). Greg Mottola directed.

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason (2004)
programme.desc: More madness and fun in this second part of the successful film that portrayed the obsessions and troubles of a thirty-year-old woman searching for the perfect man. This time, Brigdet (Renée Zellweger) seems to have found him in the discreet Mark Darcy (Colin Firth), but during a wild trip she meets up again with Daniel Cleaver (Hugh Grant), a former lover of hers, which builds up the confusion in her life, helped by Jones¿s jealousy of her boyfriend's slender girl friend.
