programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: Second World War drama starring James Belushi. North Africa, 1942: driven deep into the desert by enemy fire, Joe Gunn's lone US tank transports a mixed bag of survivors whose need for water is as desperate as their attempts to evade the enemy. With German forces closing in on them, the men must decide when and how to make a stand, even though they are heavily outnumbered.

programme.title: The Happening (2008)
programme.desc: M Night Shyamalan's end-of-the-world thriller begins in New York City with an outbreak of inexplicable suicides, which rapidly starts to take on plague proportions. As the wave of self-destruction spreads, people do their best to escape whatever it is that's causing it. Among them are Philadelphia science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) and his wife Alma (Zooey Deschanel), along with Mark's friend Julian (John Leguizamo) and his daughter Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez). Their initial plans to flee to the state capital don't work out, so they take off to the countryside, where they think they'll be safe. But it's not long before they discover that they may have made a bad choice...

programme.title: American Gods
programme.sub-title: A Prayer for Mad Sweeney. A Prayer for Mad Sweeney
programme.desc: After an over-too-quickly reunion with Shadow, Laura joins an unlikely travel companion on the road back to life and back to Shadow. Mad Sweeney's long, often tragic past is explored.

programme.title: American Gods
programme.sub-title: Come to Jesus. Come to Jesus
programme.desc: As war approaches, Mr. Wednesday needs to recruit one more Old God: Ostara, aka Easter, Goddess of the Dawn, but swaying her requires making a good impression, so Mr. Nancy is brought in.

Action film about one man's battle to save his family from a series of natural disasters caused by solar eruptions. As the Earth's core temperature rises to dangerous levels, destruction spreads worldwide and the family move from city to city to escape the danger. Meanwhile, the US president along with a determined scientist are also confident that humanity's time is not up yet.

programme.title: Love Actually (2003)
programme.desc: Set in London, this romantic comedy chronicles the affairs of several couples during Christmastime. The seemingly perfect wedding of Juliet and Peter brings many of the principals together, including heartsick best man Mark, who harbors a very unrequited crush on Juliet. There's also recent widower Daniel, trying to help his lonely stepson Sam express his true feelings to a classmate. Across town, devoted working mother Karen tries to rekindle the passion of her husband.

programme.title: Children of Men (2006)
programme.desc: Set in a dystopian future where infertility has led mankind to the brink of extinction, a sole pregnant woman holds the key to the survival of humanity. In 2027, the world's youngest person has died at the age of 18. Infertility has ravaged the world, leading it into anarchy. Eastern European and African societies have collapsed, causing their remaining populace to flee to England.

programme.title: The Happening (2008)
programme.desc: M Night Shyamalan's end-of-the-world thriller begins in New York City with an outbreak of inexplicable suicides, which rapidly starts to take on plague proportions. But it's not long before they discover that they may have made a bad choice...

programme.title: We Were Soldiers (2002)
programme.desc: Lt. Col. Hal Moore leads the 7th Cavalry into the first major battle of the Vietnam War in 1965. Contained to an area the size of a football field and surrounded by 2,000 enemy troops, Moore and his men fight for survival in one of the bloodiest engagements of the war.

programme.title: My Life in Ruins (2009)
programme.desc: After losing her teaching job in Athens, American born Georgia (Nia Vardalos) takes a job as a tour guide. But the tourists, mostly Americans, are bored with history and facts all they want to do is to shop. Hopeless and lost, Georgia gets a new chance to find her mojo when she meets a solo vacationer (Richard Dreyfuss) who maintains a jovial facade despite the fact that he misses his late wife dearly. Thanks to an unlikely friendship, Georgia comes to realize that true love may be closer than she thinks.

programme.title: Frozen (2013)
programme.desc: After the kingdom of Arendelle is cast into eternal winter by the powerful Snow Queen Elsa, her sprightly sister Anna teams up with a rough-hewn mountaineer named Kristoff and his trusty reindeer Sven to break the icy spell. Based on "The Snow Queen" by Hans Christian Andersen.

programme.title: Alice in Wonderland (2010)
programme.desc: Tim Burton fantasy featuring Lewis Carroll's creations. Alice is of marriageable age, but not inclination, when a tree root trip transports her to Wonderland, where she is greeted by creatures who seem to know her. However, she has precious little recollection of them, even though lives depend on her triumphing over the Red Queen and the fearsome Jabberwock.

programme.title: Paris Can Wait (2016)
programme.desc: While her movie-producer husband is preoccupied with work, an American woman embarks on a road trip from Cannes to Paris with a charming French business associate of his. Along the way, the pair enjoy fine food and appreciate the beauty of France.

programme.title: Children of Men (2006)
programme.desc: Set in a dystopian future where infertility has led mankind to the brink of extinction, a sole pregnant woman holds the key to the survival of humanity. In 2027, the world's youngest person has died at the age of 18. Infertility has ravaged the world, leading it into anarchy. Eastern European and African societies have collapsed, causing their remaining populace to flee to England.

programme.title: Flatliners (2017)
programme.desc: Eager to find out what the afterlife is like, five medical students seek out near-death experiences by stopping their hearts for a brief period of time. However, their visions of the great beyond turn nightmarish and take over their waking lives.

programme.title: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)
programme.desc: In this comedy set in 1965, two 12-year-olds fall in love at a summer camp and run off together into the wilderness, leaving various adults and friends to search for them as a violent storm approaches.

programme.title: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)
programme.desc: In this comedy set in 1965, two 12-year-olds fall in love at a summer camp and run off together into the wilderness, leaving various adults and friends to search for them as a violent storm approaches.

programme.title: The Karate Kid (2010)
programme.desc: Owing to his mother's career move from Detroit to China, young Dre Parker finds himself amidst unfamiliar surroundings and a school bully. Thanks to a friendly handyman, Dre learns kung-fu and grows in confidence.

programme.title: The Other Guys (2010)
programme.desc: Desk jockey Detective Allen Gamble and his tough-talking partner Terry Hoitz get their moment to shine after stumbling across a small case that threatens to blow up into something big. Gamble and Hoitz are embarrassments to the police force, but they're about to prove that hotshot detectives Danson and Highsmith aren't the only guys who can get the job done.

programme.title: About Schmidt (2002)
programme.desc: Jack Nicholson competed for an Oscar for Best Actor for his excellent performance in this sensitive drama by director Alexander Payne (Sideways). He is Warren Schmidt, a 60-year old recently retired widower who comes face to face with an uncertain future. To make his sorrow worse, his only daughter, Jeannie, is about to marry a man he despises (Dermot Mulroney). Determined to find a new sense to his tasteless life, Schmidt decides to go on a self-knowledge trip on board a trailer. In Denver, he meets his son-in-law's family and comes to detest him even more after being the victim of the strange behavior of the eccentric mother (Kathy Bates, who was nominated for an Oscar for Best Actress for her performance).

programme.title: The Beguiled (1971)
programme.desc: Offbeat western drama in which a wounded Yankee soldier finds refuge in an isolated southern girls' school towards the end of the American Civil War. The strange visitor soon becomes the object of the young women's romantic fantasies, transforming the school into a hotbed of jealousy and sexual frustration. His manipulation of the situation results in a startling, violent conclusion to this unusual drama.

programme.title: Rough Night (2017)
programme.desc: Ten years after graduating from college, five gal pals reunite for a wild bachelorette party in Miami. However, their friendships are tested when they must cover up the fact that their festivities accidentally caused the death of a male stripper.

programme.title: When in Rome (2010)
programme.desc: Disillusioned New Yorker Beth causes a frenzy in Rome when she steals a few coins from a magical fountain, which causes a number of men to fall in love with her. But when a happy-go-lucky reporter begins pursuing her, Beth must make sure his feelings for her are real.

programme.title: The Other Guys (2010)
programme.desc: Desk jockey Detective Allen Gamble and his tough-talking partner Terry Hoitz get their moment to shine after stumbling across a small case that threatens to blow up into something big. Gamble and Hoitz are embarrassments to the police force, but they're about to prove that hotshot detectives Danson and Highsmith aren't the only guys who can get the job done.

programme.title: Austin Powers in Goldmember (2002)
programme.desc: Austin boogies back to 1975 and teams up with a secret agent-disco singer to rescue his abducted father in the third Powers romp. The opening credits feature cameos by a number of celebrities.

programme.title: Coming to America (1988)
programme.desc: One of the more enjoyable films from Eddie Murphy's 80s output, this modern-day fairy tale sees the star cast as a wealthy and pampered African prince who heads to America in search of a bride. He and his friend, Semmi arrive in Queens, New York City, because according to Akeem: 'What better place to find a queen than the city of Queens?'. The prince quickly finds a job, new friends, new digs, new enemies, and more trouble than he ever bargained for. Under John Landis's assured direction, Murphy turns in a star performance (alongside several brilliant cameos) that is disciplined and, most importantly, very, very funny.

programme.title: When in Rome (2010)
programme.desc: Disillusioned New Yorker Beth causes a frenzy in Rome when she steals a few coins from a magical fountain, which causes a number of men to fall in love with her. But when a happy-go-lucky reporter begins pursuing her, Beth must make sure his feelings for her are real.

programme.title: Jurassic Park (1993)
programme.desc: Superlative special effects blockbuster. A group of scientists go to a remote island to visit a new theme park in which genetically engineered dinosaurs are the main attractions. At first the scientists are amazed, but the trip soon turns into a terrifying ordeal when the dinosaurs escape from their enclosures, and the humans find themselves trapped. The scientists and the park owner's young grandchildren must fight to stay alive against the prehistoric threat.

programme.title: I Now Pronounce You Chuck & Larry (2007)
programme.desc: Chuck Levine (Adam Sandler) and Larry Valentine (Kevin James) are two New York City firefighters and longtime friends. While widower Larry wants to ensure that his two children will be taken care of if anything should happen to him, bachelor Chuck wants to carry on with his carefree life of noncommitment. Having once been rescued by Larry from certain death, beholden Chuck has vowed to repay the favor when the time is right. So, when Larry discovers that the only means of circumventing the civic red tape that could throw his children's futures into jeopardy is to take Chuck as his lawfully wedded husband, we see a marriage in sight.

programme.title: I Now Pronounce You Chuck & Larry (2007)
programme.desc: Chuck Levine (Adam Sandler) and Larry Valentine (Kevin James) are two New York City firefighters and longtime friends. While widower Larry wants to ensure that his two children will be taken care of if anything should happen to him, bachelor Chuck wants to carry on with his carefree life of noncommitment. So, when Larry discovers that the only means of circumventing the civic red tape that could throw his children's futures into jeopardy is to take Chuck as his lawfully wedded husband, we see a marriage in sight.

programme.title: Scream 2 (1997)
programme.desc: Director Wes Craven and screenwriter Kevin Williamson reunited for this homage to slasher film sequels. Sly horror flick, but inferior to the original. Courteney Cox and Neve Campbell star with David Arquette and Jamie Kennedy.

programme.title: Along Came a Spider (2001)
programme.desc: After losing his partner in an out of control bust, forensic psychologist Dr. Alex Cross (Morgan Freeman) stops working and cannot forgive himself. But he¿s drawn back to work when a brilliant but remorseless psychopath who has landed a teaching position at an exclusive private school in Washington, D.C. abducts one of his students, the daughter of a senator. Ollie MacArthur, the detective investigating the case, has strong words for Jezzie Flannigan, the Secret Service agent who mistakenly let Megan slip through her fingers. But Dr. Cross seeks out Flannigan, who he believes might have a valuable insight into the case. Soon, they both come to the terrible realization that this crime only represents the tip of the iceberg for the ruthless criminal.

programme.title: Life (2017)
programme.desc: Astronauts on the International Space Station retrieve a sample from Mars and discover it contains evidence of intelligent life. But, the crew is thrust into danger when the specimen shows signs of aggression, threatening their entire mission.

programme.title: Jurassic Park III (2001)
programme.desc: Further prehistoric adventures from the island of dinosaurs. Dr Alan Grant reluctantly accompanies a rich couple who are searching for their teenage son who crashed on the second Jurassic Park island while paragliding. Unfortunately for the adventurers, there are many unfamiliar - and deadly - dinosaurs lurking in the jungle.

programme.title: Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day (2014)
programme.desc: An 11-year-old boy has a miserable day in which he becomes a social pariah. Meanwhile, the rest of his family deal with their own calamities—mom is late for work and dad bungles a job interview, while his sister fights a poorly timed cold and his brother has an ugly pimple.

programme.title: Rudy (1993)
programme.desc: Fact-based sports saga about an underdog obsessed with playing for one of America's top gridiron teams.

programme.title: The Eagle (2010)
programme.desc: Channing Tatum and Jamie Bell star in Kevin Macdonald's historical adventure, based on Rosemary Sutcliff's 1954 novel The Eagle of the Ninth. One of the most unthinkable things that could happen to a Roman legion was the loss of its revered eagle standard. But that was the sorry fate of the Ninth's emblem when it was marched into the mists of Caledonia, only to vanish along with the troops. Marcus Aquila feels the sorrow and shame more than most, as his father was at the head of the troops, and therefore took the brunt of the public blame. But now, two decades later, Aquila is himself a commander in the Roman army. And when he too gets posted to the north of Britannia, the temptation to rescue both the standard and his family name is too great. Slipping across the border with just his British slave Esca for company, and masquerading as the latter's slave, Aquila sets out on the most dangerous mission of his life... Also starring Mark Strong and Donald Sutherland.

programme.title: The Wedding Planner (2001)
programme.desc: A doctor falls for the woman who is coordinating his nuptials as he prepares to marry his fiancée.

programme.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park (1997)
programme.desc: Blockbuster adventure sequel. The entrepreneur who genetically engineered the dinosaurs in Jurassic Park turns out to have cloned more of the prehistoric monsters at another island location. Researchers arrive to observe the creatures in their natural habitat, but hot on their heels is a band of mercenaries intent on capturing the dinosaurs and transporting them back to the San Diego Zoo.

programme.title: Only the Brave (2017)
programme.desc: Based on a true story, a firefighting team in Arizona known as the Granite Mountain Hotshots becomes one of the country's most elite units and is deployed against a massive conflagration in 2013 that threatens their town.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: On Murtagh's first day as interim captain, the wife of a popular businessman is abducted, and the squad finds a connection to Riggs' father (guest star Rex Linn). Meanwhile, Riggs is left to grapple with his family life and work commitments. Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans star.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Make It Pop
programme.desc: Adventures with good friends and room-mates Sun Hi Song and Corki Chang.

programme.title: Mission Employable
programme.desc: Kids' documentary series looking at what it takes to become a professional at all kinds of exciting jobs. Agent Kym has a really cool task for her latest mission from the Agency - she's at an ice sculpting factory.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean chases Scrapper around Mrs Wicket's flat but her sideboard tumbles over, and when Bean sees a bit of fur poking out from under it, he thinks he has squashed Scrapper.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: When Mojo and Barbarus announce their wedding, the girls are convinced that they're up to no good.

programme.title: ToonMarty
programme.desc: Marty and his friend Burnie have fun in Toonville. Marty and Burnie are tasked with dry-cleaning Super Simon's suit, but not everything goes to plan.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by actress and DJ Gemma Atkinson and chef Stephen Terry. On the menu are onion bhajis, gin-cured salmon and chicken with deep-fried polenta.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of St Lucia, famous for its chocolate, which he puts to good sue while preparing chicken bois bande with white chocolate mash potato and chocolate drop scones with chocolate banana mash up. He takes a boat trip around the island, gets a lesson in growing cocoa plants, and attends a fish fry, where he whips up some mango coconut daquiris.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the semi-final of the skating contest. must each perform two new routines for judges Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Jason Gardiner and Ashley Banjo in the hope of winning a place in next week's grand final. Plus, a special performance from Olly Murs.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to `see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000.

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 4.45pm). The fourth round of fixtures continues with this encounter at Twickenham, where England start as overwhelming favourites to prevail. This is the 25th meeting between the nations since they first met in 1991 and England maintain a 100% record in that time. That statistic seems unlikely to come under threat this year, as Eddie Jones continues to build his squad ahead of the World Cup, while Italy have failed to make any great strides recently and sit in their customary place at the bottom of the table. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Lawrence Dallaglio, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield, Marco Bortolami and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and Ugo Monye.

programme.title: Small Fortune
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Dermot O'Leary, in which teams of three take on challenges in miniature settings. A team of dancers from Glasgow who appeared on the previous week's episode return to complete their challenge, while a trio of car dealers also compete for the cash prize of up to £150,000. Last in the series.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the third and final round of this year's battles stage, and at the end of tonight's show, the performers going through to the Knockouts will be decided. Judges Will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Tom Jones and Olly Murs take up their places in the famous red chairs as each performer tries to impress them enough to avoid the cut. However, even if the judge who selected an act decides to let them go, they still have a chance to stay in the game if they can convince one of the others to take them on.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is set for some football-themed chat as he is joined this week by Harry Redknapp, the King of the Jungle from last year's series of I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, who will no doubt be discussing his remarkable time spent in camp, and former England international and Liverpool star John Barnes. There's also a catch-up with one the leading lights of the supermodel world, Naomi Campbell, and music by Dido, who recently released her latest studio album Still on My Mind and announced her first tour in 15 years.

programme.title: The Departed
programme.desc: Oscar-winning crime drama starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon and Jack Nicholson. In the brutal South Boston underworld, a criminal gang led by the ruthless Frank Costello plants a man in the police force in a concerted effort to keep one step ahead of the law. But the authorities also have their mole, and a deadly game of cat and mouse ensues as both men struggle to conceal their true identity. \n.

programme.title: Marvel's The Avengers (2012)
programme.desc: The director of peacekeeping agency S.H.I.E.L.D. gathers an elite team of superheroes including The Hulk, Captain America, Black Widow, Iron Man and Thor when the Norse god's evil brother steals a cosmic cube from an underground base. The group must work together to protect the Earth from the leader of an extraterrestrial race and it's army intent on harnessing the cube's power. Jackson.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Fry blindly supports Planet Express's new CEO, a slick talker from Fry's time who emphasizes image as he takes on their biggest rival. Tom Kenny, Tress MacNeille, John DiMaggio.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: A Leela of Her Own. A Leela of Her Own <span >
programme.desc: Leela sees herself as a female pioneer when she's signed as a Major League pitcher, but she's really there as a novelty act, as she beans every batter she faces. Hank Aaron and Bob Uecker have cameos. Tom Kenny, Maurice LaMarche, Katey Sagal.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Aspiring to become a great cook, Bender is coached by a legend before competing against a vaunted TV chef who initially ignored him. David Herman, John DiMaggio, Maurice LaMarche.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: Crimes of the Hot. Crimes of the Hot <span >
programme.desc: Al Gore has a cameo in this episode which finds Professor Farnsworth claiming responsibility for a global-warming crisis. Billy West, Katey Sagal, John DiMaggio.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: Crimes of the Hot. Crimes of the Hot <span >
programme.desc: Al Gore has a cameo in this episode which finds Professor Farnsworth claiming responsibility for a global-warming crisis. Billy West, Katey Sagal, John DiMaggio.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: Route of All Evil. Route of All Evil <span >
programme.desc: Due to inappropriate behavior, Cubert Farnsworth and Dwight Conrad are suspended from school. They start hanging around Planet Express all day and generally annoying everyone, and their fathers tell them to get jobs.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.sub-title: Taste of Freedom. Taste of Freedom <span >
programme.desc: Dr. Zoidberg is accused of flag desecration when, at a Washington D.C. celebration, he cannot restrain himself from eating a large flag. After Zoidberg is sentenced to death, his people send an invasion force to enslave the people of Earth and teach them the meaning of freedom.

programme.title: Alien News Desk
programme.sub-title: Inane Utterings Of A Brainwashed People. Inane Utterings Of A Brainwashed People
programme.desc: Shocking reports on floating prisons, anti-poor fabrics, and a barbaric act known as ventriloquism.

programme.title: The Adjustment Bureau (2011)
programme.desc: Do we control our destiny, or do unseen forces manipulate us? Matt Damon stars in the thriller The Adjustment Bureau as a man who glimpses the future Fate has planned for him and realizes he wants something else. To get it, he must pursue the only woman he¿s ever loved across, under and through the streets of modern-day New York. On the brink of winning a seat in the U.S. Senate, ambitious politician David Norris (Damon) meets beautiful contemporary ballet dancer Elise Sellas (Emily Blunt)¿a woman like none he¿s ever known. But just as he realizes he¿s falling for her, mysterious men conspire to keep the two apart. David learns he is up against the agents of Fate itself¿the men of The Adjustment Bureau¿who will do everything in their considerable power to prevent David and Elise from being together. In the face of overwhelming odds, he must either let her go and accept a predetermined path¿or risk everything to defy Fate and be with her.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.sub-title: A Stop at Willoughby. A Stop at Willoughby <span >
programme.desc: A harried ad exec escapes stress in a dream about a sleepy town of the past. Williams: James Daly (father of actors Tyne and Tim Daly). Jane: Patricia Donahue. Misrell: Howard Smith. Helen: Mavis Neal.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: A lovesick suitor buys a guaranteed love potion, which works---too well. Based on a story by John Collier. Roger: George Grizzard. Leila: Patricia Barry. Daemon: John McIntire. Man in Homburg: J. Pat O'Malley. Blonde: Barbara Perry. Host: Rod Serling.

programme.title: Identity theft (?)
programme.sub-title: learn about it and how to get LifeLock protection. learn about it and how to get LifeLock protection
programme.desc: Are you at risk for identity theft? Get the facts from experts, and hear stories from victims. Discover how LifeLock can help protect you – with proprietary technology, and U.S.-based agents who help set things right if your identity is ever stolen.

programme.title: Power Air Fryer Oven (?)
programme.desc: The Groundbreaking Chef-Quality Air Fryer Oven! It's an Air Fryer, Rotisserie, and Dehydrator - all in one!

programme.title: PIYO WORKOUT! (?)
programme.desc: Define your body with PiYo. Chalene Johnson's new lower-impact workout series combining the muscle-sculpting benefits of Pilates, Yoga and fluid motion all-in-one!

programme.title: Hoover SmartWash Makes Deep Cleaning Easy! (?)
programme.desc: Hoover SmartWash is a powerful, lightweight and easy to use carpet washer that makes your old carpets look new again!

programme.title: Hanna (2011)
programme.desc: Hanna has lived most her life, with just her father Erik for company, in the remote far north of Scandinavia. Their hermit-like, self-sufficient existence is the result of a dark happening in Erik's former life as a CIA operative. If the Agency ever find him he will be killed - and so will his daughter. But now, aged 16, Hanna yearns for engagement with the world from which her father has determinedly kept her secluded. And, much to her surprise, and despite the immediate and extreme danger to which that will expose her, he accedes to her wish. However, it's not as though Hanna's not prepared: for as long as she can remember (and probably even before then), Erik has efficiently and expertly tutored his daughter in the craft of lethal self-defence and assassination. But will that be enough to save her from Marissa Wiegler, the ruthless CIA agent tasked with crossing them off her hit list? With Tom Hollander, Olivia Williams and Jason Flemyng.

programme.title: The Adjustment Bureau (2011)
programme.desc: Do we control our destiny, or do unseen forces manipulate us? Matt Damon stars in the thriller The Adjustment Bureau as a man who glimpses the future Fate has planned for him and realizes he wants something else. To get it, he must pursue the only woman he¿s ever loved across, under and through the streets of modern-day New York. On the brink of winning a seat in the U.S. Senate, ambitious politician David Norris (Damon) meets beautiful contemporary ballet dancer Elise Sellas (Emily Blunt)¿a woman like none he¿s ever known. But just as he realizes he¿s falling for her, mysterious men conspire to keep the two apart. David learns he is up against the agents of Fate itself¿the men of The Adjustment Bureau¿who will do everything in their considerable power to prevent David and Elise from being together. In the face of overwhelming odds, he must either let her go and accept a predetermined path¿or risk everything to defy Fate and be with her.

programme.title: Seventh Son (2015)
programme.desc: A knight and his new apprentice battle a malevolent witch plotting war against mankind. However, their quest is complicated by the apprentice's secret past and his love for a woman accused of witchcraft.

programme.title: Ghost Rider (2007)
programme.desc: Johnny Blaze is a talented motorcyclist that takes the hard decision to sell his soul to the devil in order to save his father life, affected by a terminal cancer. Even though he fulfilled his part of the deal, his father dies and he is forced to leave his hometown, his friends and his love. Ears later, he becomes a world-renowned acrobat and in one of his shows he meets again Roxanne, his old girlfriend. But Mephistopheles intrudes once again in their lives with a dangerous mission in mind: to fight against his tough and rude son, that wants to install hell on earth and make everybody¿s life miserable. Nevertheless, this is the only chance that Johnny has to recover the control of his destiny.

programme.title: Marvel's The Avengers (2012)
programme.desc: The director of peacekeeping agency S.H.I.E.L.D. gathers an elite team of superheroes including The Hulk, Captain America, Black Widow, Iron Man and Thor when the Norse god's evil brother steals a cosmic cube from an underground base. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: The Big Guns. The Big Guns <span >
programme.desc: Fed up with Ronnie and Amber's boat on their front lawn, the Dunphys strike back by calling on Phil's dad and his retired friends to help them prove a point. Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria clash over Joe's potty training; and Cameron takes Lily to clown school, but doesn't tell Mitchell about it.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil is afraid that the teenage Luke is starting to push him away, but Andy is ready to fill the void. Meanwhile, Jay has a dilemma when Joe may be allergic to Stella; and Mitchell does some freelance legal work at his father's closet company, where he frequently crosses paths with Claire.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Fight or Flight. Fight or Flight <span >
programme.desc: Phil's long reunion weekend with his old cheerleading friends prompts Claire to lobby for a first-class seat on the flight home, leaving her husband in coach. Meanwhile, Gloria wants Jay to teach Manny how to stand up to a bully in his cooking class; and Mitchell, Cameron and Pepper throw a belated baby shower for Sal.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire's stuck at the airport and her computer is her lifeline when she's trying to contact Haley after a big fight, and the whole family gets involved in the online drama.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.sub-title: Closet? You'll Love It! Closet? You'll Love It! <span >
programme.desc: Jay and Claire shoot a commercial for Pritchett Closets to counter a rival's splashy ad, but dad and daughter have conflicting creative visions. Meanwhile, Phil, Luke and Manny try to take down a Peeping Tom's drone that's spying on a sunbathing Gloria; Cameron is nervous about Lily's performance in a school talent show; and Haley worries about Andy when he's rushed to the hospital with appendicitis.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire tackles spring cleaning, while Phil worries that Luke is getting better than he is at just about everything. Elsewhere, Haley tries to get Alex's mind off school by taking her to a music festival; and Gloria and Jay promise to give up their vices of Spanish soap operas and cigars, respectively, but it's easier said than done when Gloria attends Cameron's faculty talent show and Jay goes with Mitchell to pick up Lily at camp.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay's birthday comes with a number of interesting gifts, including Phil's high-tech outdoor grill, and Claire and Mitchell's offer to pay back some ancient loans—though they don't think he'll actually accept it. Meanwhile, Gloria teaches Manny and Luke a lesson about drinking; and Andy finds himself in an awkward situation when Haley brings her new doctor boyfriend.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam asks Jay to sub in on his bowling team for the finals, but doesn't make it clear that it's an all-gay league, which puts Jay in a precarious situation. Meanwhile, Phil and Claire are surprised by how much fun they have at dinner with their neighbours Ronnie and Amber; and Gloria and Mitch set out to prove they are still young and fun by agreeing to a night of clubbing with Haley.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Phil pick up Lily's hand-me-down princess castle for Joe, but Jay worries that his son is playing with too many girlie things, and Phil is mad that Claire doesn't want him to buy a video-game console. Meanwhile, Mitchell and Cameron babysit Joe and wonder what it would be like to have another child; Gloria helps Haley assert herself at work; and Claire tries to get Luke an award at school by bribing the principal.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Alex learns she has to share valedictorian honors with a rival, but the tie could be broken by a 1-mile run for a gym grade neither has completed. programme.title: The Mechanic (2011)
programme.desc: Arthur Bishop (Jason Statham) is an elite assassin with a unique talent for making any job seem like natural causes or an accident if necessary. His job requires professional perfection and total detachment, and Bishop is the best in the business. But when his mentor and close friend Harry (Donald Sutherland) is murdered his world goes upside down. Harry's son Steve approaches him with a vengeful goal and a determination to learn Bishop's trade. Bishop has always acted alone but he can't turn his back on Harry's son, who becomes his apprentice. Things change though when Arthur learns that the circumstances surrounding Harry's hit is not what he was told.

programme.title: Limitless (2011)
programme.desc: Struggling author Eddie Morra (Bradley Cooper) overcomes his writer's block with a new drug that unlocks the full potential of his brain, and he forges a partnership with a businessman (Robert De Niro) seeking to capitalize on his extraordinary skills. programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The InterContinental Shanghai Wonderland, a 337-room hotel that burrows 16 stories below ground level, clinging to the cliffs of an abandoned quarry.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Kenfig, south Wales, to search for the remains of the once-thriving harbour town believed to have been buried beneath sand dunes in a series of storms more than 500 years ago. The archaeologists have only three days to determine the size of the lost community and search for evidence of the battles between the locals and the Anglo-Norman settlers.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to the Roman legionary fort of Caerleon, in Gwent, where they investigate evidence that a huge structure - a courtyard surrounded by stone buildings - once led from the fort down to the River Usk. Archaeologists from Cardiff University help shed new light on what was once seen solely as a military outpost.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: China's Megatomb: Secrets of the Terracotta Army
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the tomb of China's first Emperor and its army of Terracotta Warriors, revealing the macabre secrets that have challenged accepted historical records.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians travel to Nottinghamshire, where residents of Clipstone village near Sherwood Forest believe some impressive ruins in a farmer's field may have played a part in the ancient tales of Robin Hood and Bad King John. The extensive building records and high-quality carvings prove a fine building existed somewhere nearby, but finding out what it looked like and how large it was frustrates the archaeologists.

programme.title: Timewatch: QE2 - The Final Voyage
programme.desc: Documentary following the history and farewell voyage of RMS Queen Elizabeth 2, the world's longest-serving cruise ship, which was launched in 1967 and decommissioned in November 2008. Timewatch travels to Southampton for the QE2's last-ever trip, joining crew and passengers to recall her humble beginnings and eventful service record. With contributions by Ben Kingsley, Tony Curtis and Simon Weston.

programme.title: Stonehenge: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on a 45-mile walk across Wiltshire, from Avebury to Stonehenge, telling the story of the remarkable development that occurred in the latter days of the Neolithic era. His route over chalk downlands and Salisbury Plain takes him through one of the greatest concentrations of prehistoric sites in Europe.

programme.title: The Lakes: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Cornwall: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Discover more about the history of industrial engineering along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal as Time Team's Tony Robinson embarks on a three-day walk inland to Wigan.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe narrates a selection of Top of the Pops performances by George Michael and Andrew Ridgeley's duo, featuring Young Guns (Go For It!), Wham Rap! (Enjoy What You Do), Bad Boys, Club Tropicana, Wake Me Up Before You Go-Go, Freedom, Everything She Wants and Edge of Heaven.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe presents a look back at some classic Duran Duran Top of the Pops performances.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How the world's biggest ship, designed to install oil platforms and lay pipelines, was inspired by a logging machine, a wire rope and 1940s shipbuilding techniques.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Historian Stephen Baxter explores his own theory that the Domesday Book was commissioned to confer revolutionary powers on the monarchy in the 11th century, and not intended as a means to collect taxes. He examines how the first great national survey, which recorded who owned every piece of land and property in England, was a massive logistical exercise that documented the traumatic impact of the Norman Conquest.
